website_summaries.verdict: For the price, this electric cordless trimmer rocks. Packed with features that should fulfill all basic outdoor needs.
pros: Great tool for smaller suburban yards
Extremely light trimmer is powered by a Lithium-ion battery that can be swapped from other Ryobi tools
Easy conversion to edger mode and comes with an auto string advance
cons: Cutting swath is narrower than most

customer_reviews.title: Good weed wacker
customer_reviews.text: This makes wacking the weeds and grass around the perimeter of the property a lot more convenient, no messing with gas, oil or pulling a little string until your shoulder falls off, just charge it up and let it get with it. The battery last a lot longer than I do so I only have to charge it about every third time I use it, and I mean I do use it for the wacker, the hedge trimmer and the other add on's I have.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Lakin

customer_reviews.title: trimmer in winter.
customer_reviews.text: although I bough this product in winter and did not open the box until spring I discovered a faulty machine (per manufacturer) seller refused to extend warrant.. strongly suggest to STAY AWAY as they sell faulty products
customer_reviews.author: jeff smith

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer! :)
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmer! Love the interchangeable extensions, for I bought a chainsaw and brush trimmer to go with this trimmer. The only downside is the the trimmer line spool does not always extend out properly, for it gets tangled inside, thus I have to rewind the spool. Other wise, it's a good trimmer with a good long lasting rechargeable battery. :)
customer_reviews.author: George P.

customer_reviews.title: 40 volts gives this weedeater all the power it needs.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first battery powered weedeater I’ve owned that compares with a gas powered. Amazing machine. Attachments are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: The product is great if the batteries would last
customer_reviews.text: I guess this is more of a question then a review. Has anyone else had a problem with the 40 v lithium battery? So far two of my 40 V batteries won't recharge. They are less then 6 months old. The product is great if the batteries would last. Is there a to way to get them replaced?
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: One problem
customer_reviews.text: More powerful than single string version. Has a bad location for the power switch which causes wrist tension.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Power of gas? No. Enough power for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Update....screw stripped on collar that holds on attachments....warranty useless despite registering with Ryobi....run from this cheap piece of garbage....Ryobi will NOT stand behind their products....will never buy another product from them...ever. Power of gas? No. Enough power for a string trimmer? Indeed. No smelly gas or fumes. Wife can use it. Well balanced and takes up barely any space in the garage compared to my old gas unit. Not enough power for the edger attachment(at least not for St Augustine grass), but the trimmer works quite well. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: E. Brooke Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and just plain heavy
customer_reviews.text: I love the power of the 40V battery, and it does heavy duty work. My only concern is the weight of the battery and power leaves my hands shaking like crazy for an hour or so after use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Fox

customer_reviews.title: I love using it
customer_reviews.text: I love using this weedeater, without needing to mess with a temperamental gas engine. I also like the ability to use attachments (blower, pole saw, etc). Has a good amount of power.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun C Wackerly

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe it's not gas.
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is better than a gas trimmer because you don't have all the messing with mixing oil into your gasoline, you don't have all the noise, and you don't have all the dirty exhaust. What you do get is a powerful device that is more than enough for your average yard.
customer_reviews.author: John Tebbutt

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. A very good weed eater at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works fine light to medium duty
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and a cinch to use. Worked for a half hour 15 minutes after iPhone the box. Feels ergonomic enough and quieter than old gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed at the battery life, I used larger string for long life. A++ in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Abney

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool, Bad Weed Whacker
customer_reviews.text: Love the flexibility of the ability to add other tools. The the "weed whacker" is a bust.
customer_reviews.author: Sidd

customer_reviews.title: Great produce. Works as well as a gas powered ...
customer_reviews.text: Great produce. Works as well as a gas powered one.
customer_reviews.author: Warren.     you all

customer_reviews.title: MISSING A BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but never received a battery so i really cant let you people know more about it,but I'm sure it sounds and worx nice cus its a Ryobi.Good company to do bizz with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Then I found out the battery was bad according to the self check indicator lights
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in a badly damaged box. The reciever tube was slightly bent, so I had to straighten it out before the lower unit would fit. Then I found out the battery was bad according to the self check indicator lights. Absolutely no reaction when I installed it and hit the switch. Sent it back to Lorena's flowers two weeks ago and have heard nothing yet. Worst Amazon transaction ever.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very weak. Brand new, after getting a full charge, it can't really wack down the weeks. It bends them over and the long weeds wrap around the spool and jam it. Might be good for edging a lawn, but not good for taking down tall weeds. It doesn't really work on shorted weeds either. You need to make multiple passes to cut them down. Only plus side is that it is quick. convenient, and light enough for my 9 year old some to use. But not what we need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Trago Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Manuals Are Really Pathetic
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmer, very happy with it, but the documentation that comes with it is absolute rubbish. Tiny "mini-manuals" with crummy miniature drawings that are next to useless. Plus there's no parts lists or breakdowns so that when in the future one might need to find a replacement for a worn part (like a bump cap or spool) you'll have to spend hours on the Internet. I guess Ryobi would rather you just go buy a whole new trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Works when it actually functions but I have had major issues.
customer_reviews.text: I have now been through three of these. The first one had a major issue with the battery being defective out of the box. The replacement I got had a bad motor that stopped functioning within about seven days. The third one also had a defective battery that showed up less than two months into using it. The bolt that holds in the expandable attachments also stripped out within this time.I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Iammistercraig

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmer! Battery lasts at least as long as a tank of gas did in our previous trimmers, and I don't have to fight to start the thing. The string lasts longer and deploys better than any trimmer I have ever owned. The battery recharges quickly, but I bought a second battery because we have a large yard.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality knob/coupler
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this model elsewhere, but wanted to post a heads-up - Works very good when it works, hence the second star. Three year warranty doesn't cover squat. My knob/coupler stripped year two - they want me to pay for another from their parts depot(!) Why??? It's very soft (cheap) metal. It will strip again. Now I have to rig up some other option. This never happened with my previous ExpandIt model. Ryobi won't stand behind this product. Replaced spool mechanism - string did not come out easily, bump or not. Design sucks. Order a better one from Amazon, throw Ryobi's away. Minus the coupler, unit and battery have held up two seasons of lawn care on my small lawn.
customer_reviews.author: JDubs

customer_reviews.title: Defective Battery and Charger
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product. Used it a few times. After two years the extra battery I purchased was defective. After 3 years, the charger was defective. I seriously used this weed eater only several times. I’ll buy a Makita. No more Ryobis for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Boyce

customer_reviews.title: 3 of my 4 batterys are bad. Home depot directs me to Ryobi not helpful ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 of my 4 batterys are bad. Home depot directs me to Ryobi not helpful at all. I bought all the electric lawn equipment. Big expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Skip ryobi and go w/another battery powered version
customer_reviews.text: Decent weedeater.... It would be an awesome one if it had QUALITY batteries... Word to the wise SKIP RYOBI AND GO W/ANOTHER BATTERY POWERED VERSION
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Miller

customer_reviews.title: $ down the toilet
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasted less than 3 years, I missed my warranty window. $ down the toilet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charged the battery like instructed, went to edging
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this trimmer. Charged the battery like instructed, went to edging. 15 minutes battery dead. If this is normal, can,t live with this.
customer_reviews.author: G Hall

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THE STRING TRIMMER WITH THE POWER HEAD AND BATTERY/CHARGER SO THAT I COULD USE THE POWER HEAD WITH MY TROY BUILT GAS POWER HEAD ATTACHMENTS, TRIMMER, CULTIVATOR, BLOWER, POLE SAW AND EXTENDED REACH HEDGE TRIMMER. I LOVE THIS BATTERY OPERATED POWER HEAD SO MUCH I HAVE PURCHASED THE CHAINSAW AND THE HEDGE TRIMMER. GOT RID OF MY HEAVY ELECTRIC REMINGTON HEDGE TRIMMER (JUNK) AND ONLY USE THE GAS POWER HEAD FOR BIG JOBS WHEN RECHARGING MAY BE AN ISSUE. THE RUN TIME OF THE 40 VOLT LI-ION BATTERY IS FANTASTIC AND THE EQUIPMENT IS NOT VERY HEAVY. LOW NOISE , NO POLLUTION NO GAS AND NO CORDS....IT DOESN'T GET ANY BETTER
customer_reviews.author: WAYNE W.

product_meta.title: Ryobi RY40220 40V Cordless Lithium-Ion 13 in. Expand-It X String Trimmer
product_meta.description: RYOBI introduces the new 40V X String Trimmer featuring Gas-Like Power, without the hassle of gas and oil or the trouble of toting around an extension cord. This powerful trimmer features a REEL-EASY bump feed string head for fast and easy reloading and premium .080 in. twisted dual line for cutting through brush and thicker grass. RYOBI takes the 40V lithium-ion family of tools to the next generation by introducing the first cordless attachment capable system with gas-like power. Add the Expand-it cultivator, blower or even edger to the bottom shaft of the RYOBI 40V X String Trimmer power head and quickly transform your lawn from overgrown to manicured. This variable speed trigger, adjustable cutting width string trimmer runs off of the same 40V Li-ion battery as all other RYOBI 40V tools. Whether you have one of the original 40V batteries or tools from 2012 or are just getting into the system today, all RYOBI 40V batteries and tools are compatible with one another. Backed by a RYOBI 3 year warranty, become a part of the gas-like power family with the RYOBI 40V X String Trimmer.
